Headline: Senate extends lockdown until April 12 – Manila Bulletin
Text: The Senate is again extending the imposition of a lockdown in its premises until April 12 to curb the spread of COVID-19 among its employees.Senate President Vicente Sotto III said during their plenary session on Wednesday, March 24, that they will heed the recommendation of chamber’s medical services bureau and the Senate sergeant-at-arms. “Starting tomorrow (March 25), it will be on lockdown until after Holy Week…The hearings that you have to conduct, you will have to conduct it virtually, there will be no one here in the Senate until April 12,” Sotto told his colleagues.The Senate’s building in Pasay City was placed under a total lockdown starting last Thursday, March 18, after 24 of its employees tested positive for COVID-19. Work was also suspended.The chamber only resumed hybrid hearings and session Wednesday for the Commission on Appointments and also to take up and pass bills before the 18th Congress goes on a two-month recess. Plenary sessions will resume on May 17. In an advisory signed by Senate Secretary Myra Villarica, Senate employees were told that work will also be suspended from April 5 to April 8, and will resume on April 12.But a resolution allows Senate committees to conduct virtual hearings and consultations during the break, Senate Majority Leader Juan Miguel Zubiri noted.Sotto told his colleagues that they might convene for the Committee on the Whole hearing on April 6 to investigate issues with the Department of Agriculture’s importation of pork in relation to the African swine fever outbreak.
